node.title: Sole traders optimistic business will improve, despite Covid-19 restrictions
node.description: Ongoing Covid-19-related restrictions are taking a toll on sole traders' economic outlook, but they are much more positive about their business.

node.title: NZ borders opening increases risk of measles outbreak - Southern DHB
node.description: The Southern District Health Board is encouraging people to ensure they are up to date with their measles, mumps and rubella vaccinations to reduce the risk of a measles outbreak.

node.title: Man dies after hospital fails to properly record allergy
node.description: A DHB has been criticised by the Health and Disability Commissioner after a man died from being given an antibiotic for a sore toe.

node.title: Oscar-winning actor William Hurt dead at age 71
node.description: Oscar-winning actor William Hurt known for his roles in movies such as Kiss of the Spider Woman and Broadcast News, has died at the age of 71.

node.title: NZ's Andrews wins Freeski Slopestyle Junior World Championships
node.description: Queenstown teenager Ruby Andrews has won the freeski slopestyle title at the Junior World Championships in Switzerland.

node.title: Police: 1 suspect responsible for 5 shootings of homeless people in NYC, Washington DC
node.description: The suspect is believed to be responsible for five shootings, two of them fatal, in the month of March, police said.

node.title: Act Party wants to give everyone $187 per year to counter cost of living
node.description: The Act Party wants to give everyone in the country $187 a year funded from Emissions Trading Scheme revenue to counter the rising cost of living.

node.title: Owners of untidy central Christchurch properties may see rates quadrupled
node.description: Financial incentives and penalties may be used to get unkempt lots tidied up in the city centre.

node.title: Owners of untidy central Chtistchurch properties may see rates quadrupled
node.description: Financial incentives and penalties may be used to get unkempt lots tidied up in the city centre.

node.title: UK to pay people who open homes to Ukraine refugees
node.description: Britain will pay people Â£350 a month if they can offer refugees a spare room or property for a minimum period of six months.

node.title: Waitomo warning about rising petrol prices 'no gimmick', company says
node.description: The Waitomo fuel company says comments it made on Friday about an imminent price rise were about being transparent with customers - and not a marketing stunt.

node.title: Jane Campion's 'The Power of the Dog' takes top BAFTA award
node.description: The Power of the Dog has won best film at the Bafta awards, with Jane Campion also taking the best director accolade.

node.title: Gisborne District Council settles on zero net carbon by 2030
node.description: Gisborne District Council is one step closer to its goal of reaching carbon neutrality, adopting a 2030 net-zero target at a Thursday meeting.

node.title: Police investigating cleaning company after graphic posts
node.description: Police have launched an investigation into a trauma cleaning company that for years posted graphic pictures of callout scenes.

node.title: Tom Brady says he's returning to the NFL after announcing retirement
node.description: "I've realized my place is still on the field and not in the stands," Brady tweeted.

node.title: Pete Buttigieg explains how the infrastructure law will affect you
node.description: Sec. of Transportation Pete Buttigieg says improvements are coming to American infrastructure, from road and bridge repairs to a new network of electric car charging ports.

node.title: William Hurt, Oscar-winning actor, dies at 71
node.description: In a long-running career, Hurt was nominated for four Academy Awards, winning for 1985's "Kiss of the Spider Woman."

node.title: Police appeal for information after pedestrian fatally hit on SH1
node.description: Police are appealing for information following the death of a pedestrian on State Highway 1 in Piarere, Tirau on Saturday.

node.title: 'Kidney disease is silent' - Expert calls for further intervention
node.description: A medical expert says more needs to be done about chronic kidney disease in New Zealand. Audio

node.title: Ukraine says power has been restored to Chernobyl plant
node.description: The plant is currently held by Russian troops.

node.title: White Ferns slump against Australia
node.description: The White Ferns have fallen to a weak 141-run defeat to their favoured trans-Tasman rivals in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup in Wellington.

node.title: Focus on Politics: Luxon's cuts putting Labour on guard

node.title: New child sexual violence services in limbo
node.description: Oranga Tamariki has not had any meetings with MÄori to design new sexual violence services for children even as unmet demand ratchets up.

node.title: Cabinet to consider border exemptions for Ukrainians' relatives
node.description: Cabinet will today consider how to help New Zealand-based Ukrainians who want to bring relatives here. Audio

node.title: Video to play key part in Jan. 6 hearings and report
node.description: Rather than relying on a report text, these hearings are expected to use video and multimedia elements, similar to approach used in Trump's second impeachment trial.

node.title: Taranaki composting plant flunks latest environmental report
node.description: A controversial North Taranaki composting and worm farming business has flunked its latest environmental monitoring report.

node.title: Groundswell protest leaders to meet with PM
node.description: The prime minister will meet with Groundswell protest leaders after previously declining their requests to speak to her.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on March 13, 2022

node.title: Barack Obama says he tested positive for COVID-19
node.description: The former president said he is "feeling fine" other than a scratchy throat.
